name: The White Morph Heritage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are a bit motel-like,(one slider opening to the walkway, no windows) but comfortable-our room had a view of the water. Breakfast is next door at a cafe (busy but not slow). The restaurant at the White Morph is excellent - make your dinner reservations early. On the other hand, ask yourself if you really want to go to this town. The day we were there the whales, for which it is famous, were in short supply. Comfortable beds and nice large rooms. Across the street from the beach, so there is a nice walk along the ocean. Staff was very helpful with getting from hotel to whale watch, calling taxi, etc. This hotel is not walking distance from the train station, so if you are coming by train arrange for the taxi/shuttle to meet you at the train.
reviews.title: If you want to go to Kakoura this is a good choice

reviews.text: Have stayed here twice now and cannot fault either time. The front-desk staff were great- they had a sense of humour that some people might not get (not "smart-alecky" by any means!) but that sometimes comes with being a Kiwi. Was lucky enough to be upgraded to a Spa room on my first stay and having stayed in a standard room the second time, the extra money is definitely worthwhile! Extra space, beautiful spa and large windows overlooking the water. The restaurant is probably the best in Kaikoura and meals were amazing with great service there too.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, great view and fantastic restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Inn is perfect if you are looking for somewhere to stay for a few days while exploring the area which is stunning. The rooms are spacious, clean & tidy. There are good laundry facilities although they may be under pressure during peak season. It is situated opposite the beach and next door to a lovely cafe that served great breakfasts. The office for booking dolphin & albatross trips is also in the same building. The Inn also has a restaurant that served great food tho the crayfish were rather expensive. There are lots of other good restaurants within walking distance. It's not a five star hotel but the staff were helpful, (very accommodating for our very late arrival) and we had 3 great days there and will definitely use it again if we are lucky enough to return.
reviews.title: "Suited our needs perfectly"

reviews.text: Great view and best spa bath I have had. Great place to stay.
reviews.title: Very pleasent stay
You can probably do better in kaikoura
reviews.text: Our room was OK, but not worth the price. Charging $14 for an internet connection that worked like a 20 year old dialup was outrageous. Front desk staff too smart alecky for our taste. Would look elsewhere next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights and had a great stay. It was easy to find and only 10 min walk from the far end of town. The motel is positioned on the waterfront and there are sea facing rooms (although we were not allocated one).
reviews.title: Nice room, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was well equipped and very clean.
reviews.title: Well worth the stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were plenty of restaurants within 5 min walk, and many restaurants offer a nice selection of fish.
reviews.title: Still a winner

reviews.text: We went Whale Watching and the Whale Watch Station was only a 15 min walk away.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.text: The owner was very pleasant and accomodating. The view was what US would call filtered however we had a corner room and it was fine. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Well worth the cost.
reviews.title: Good place to stay in kaikoura

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The White Morph offers a fantastic location overlooking the sea on the edge of Kaikoura and positioned on a main road which, fortunately, is lightly trafficed at night.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: We opted for an executive room which was well appointed and spacious. A next door cafe offers good breakfasts and for dinner the adjoining White Morph Restaurant is excellent. On the night we were there the servicing of a large coach party did not detract unduly from the service and the food was first class. I would recommend booking dinner at this popular venue at the same time as reserving your accommodation. The pleasant staff can arrange this.
reviews.title: Best motel we stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the Inn all the major attractions - whale watching, etc. are all reachable within a 5-10 minute drive.
reviews.title: Great location friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms and furniture are new. Bedrooms spacious. Among the clean(est) and neat(est). Had all we needed. Living area was downstairs and bedrooms upstairs which is not great if you have a one-year-old. Unlike some I would not be so bold as to say it's walking distance to the town but if you are staying in a motel you probably have a car - use it. Patrick was very helpfull - among the most friendly hosts we encountered in NZ. The sign stating fee will be charged unless you check-out before 10.00 is a bit harsh though.
reviews.title: Worth a Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at White Morp for two nights and enjuyed the peace and location we stayed an extra night. Walking disance to most places, clean toy room, friendly helpful staff, all facalitiies catered for.
reviews.title: White Morph - perfect for a stay in Kaikoura

reviews.text: We got two walk in rooms when we arrived late into Kaikoura. Good clean accommodation with adequate parking. We had the rooms to the side (the sea facing ones were much more expensive) and had a great dinner at the White Morph restaurant next door (they have some great wine pairings). A really good option if you are in Kaikoura!
reviews.title: Good option in Kaikoura

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasant motel with well maintained, clean, large rooms with full facilities, including kitchenette, microwave, fridge etc. Only rooms in the front have sea views to die for, so we had to get out and have a stroll outside, on the waterfront, to enjoy the area.
reviews.title: Very pleasant accommodation option in Kaikoura

reviews.text: Restaurants and cafes are nearby, including an excellent one next door to the hotel. The manager at the desk was most helpful and cheerful at all times adding to the pleasant atmosphere of the place. The hotel does not provide internet facilities in the rooms but guests are given the option of buying wifi time from a local provider at $2 for 20 MB, adequate for emails and brief news updates.
reviews.title: bosshogs view

reviews.text: A good accommodation option at this part of the NZ coast.
reviews.title: Great View but Cold Showers...

reviews.text: I found this Motel first class, with friendly management. The restaurant accommodated us with a last minute booking at end of their opening time, then they produced a very nice meal. We found the bed extremely comfortable. Would definitely stay here again next time we are in Kaikoura.
reviews.title: Better places to stay

description: The White Morph Heritage, is on the waterfront in Kaikoura NZ, All the luxury Spa rooms face the ocean with full views and adjacent to the Dolphin Encounter and Cafe. On site restaurant, Cinema and house bar. Very close proximity to the shops 15min, walk or 2 mins in your car. Our Garden studios are facing the garden, sunny and only 30 mtrs from the shore. The White Morph Heritage has a range of accommodation to suite different travellers with differing needs.
